meta.title: The ATLAS Directive - Impact Scenario Modeling
meta.description: High-stakes analysis of potential impact scenarios for 3I/ATLAS.

nodes.title: Impact Scenario Modeling Gateway
nodes.body_md:
**IMPACT SCENARIO MODELING**: Gravitational analysis reveals a non-zero probability of 3I/ATLAS impacting a celestial body in our solar system.

**BRANCHING FROM**: Main ATLAS Directive analysis stream
**FOCUS**: Trajectory analysis, risk assessment, and mitigation planning.
**SCIENTIFIC VALUE**: Understanding the potential risks of interstellar objects is crucial for planetary defense.

nodes.title: Impact Probability Calculation
nodes.body_md: **SKILL CHECK: Orbital Mechanics**\n\nBased on the latest trajectory data, which celestial body has the highest probability of being impacted by 3I/ATLAS?

nodes.title: Impact Analysis Error
nodes.body_md: **INCORRECT ANALYSIS**: Your calculations are flawed. Re-run the simulation and account for all gravitational perturbations.

nodes.title: Mars Impact Scenario
nodes.body_md: **MARS IMPACT SCENARIO**: Your analysis is correct. There is a 0.1% probability of 3I/ATLAS impacting Mars. This is a significant risk that requires immediate attention.\n\n**NEXT STEPS**: Develop a mitigation plan.

nodes.title: Mitigation Plan Options
nodes.body_md: **MITIGATION PLAN OPTIONS**: You have several options to mitigate the risk of a Mars impact. Each has its own risks and rewards.

nodes.title: Laser Ablation Scenario
nodes.body_md: **LASER ABLATION**: This plan involves using a high-powered laser to vaporize parts of 3I/ATLAS, altering its trajectory. It's a high-risk, high-reward option that could either save Mars or shatter the object into multiple, unpredictable threats.

choices.label: The laser successfully diverts the object.
The laser shatters the object, creating a new crisis.

nodes.title: Kinetic Impactor Scenario
nodes.body_md: **KINETIC IMPACTOR**: This plan involves sending a spacecraft to collide with 3I/ATLAS, altering its trajectory. It's a medium-risk, medium-reward option with a moderate chance of success.

choices.label: The impactor successfully diverts the object.
The impactor fails to significantly alter the object's course.

nodes.title: Gravity Tractor Scenario
nodes.body_md: **GRAVITY TRACTOR**: This plan involves sending a spacecraft to fly alongside 3I/ATLAS, using its gravity to slowly pull the object off course. It's a low-risk, low-reward option that is slow but reliable.

choices.label: The tractor successfully diverts the object over several months.

nodes.title: Laser Ablation Success
nodes.body_md: **MISSION ACCOMPLISHED**: The laser ablation plan was a resounding success. 3I/ATLAS was successfully diverted from its collision course with Mars, and the object is now on a safe trajectory out of the solar system.

nodes.title: Laser Ablation Failure
nodes.body_md: **CATASTROPHIC FAILURE**: The laser ablation plan has failed catastrophically. 3I/ATLAS has shattered into multiple fragments, and several are now on a collision course with Earth. You have traded one crisis for another, far worse one.

nodes.title: Kinetic Impactor Success
nodes.body_md: **MISSION ACCOMPLISHED**: The kinetic impactor successfully diverted 3I/ATLAS from its collision course with Mars. The object is now on a safe trajectory.

nodes.title: Kinetic Impactor Failure
nodes.body_md: **MISSION FAILURE**: The kinetic impactor failed to significantly alter the object's course. The impact with Mars is now imminent.

nodes.title: Gravity Tractor Success
nodes.body_md: **MISSION ACCOMPLISHED**: The gravity tractor successfully diverted 3I/ATLAS over a period of several months. The threat to Mars has been neutralized.
